matchTwissParameters: Use twiss parameters computed from the selected beamline
randomSeed: The seed for the random number generator for particles

particle: The name of particles in the beam.
mass: The restmass of the particles in the beam.
charge: The electrical charge of the particles in the beam in units of the proton charge
gamma: Relativistic factor, ie the ratio between total energy and rest energy of the particles.
beta: Ratio between the speed of the particles and the speed of light.
sequence: Attaches the beam command to a specific sequence.
kbunch: The number of particle bunches in the machine.
npart: The number of particles per bunch.
bunched: The beam is treated as bunched whenever this makes sense.
radiate: Synchrotron radiation is considered in all bipolar magnets.
bv: The direction of the particle movement in a beam line.

file: The named file is read until a RETURN statement is encountered, or until the EOF.

sequence: Sequence for which the constraint applies
range: Position where the constraint must be satisfied

dx: The misalignment in the x-direction for the entry of the beam element.
dy: The misalignment in the y-direction for the entry of the beam element.
ds: The misalignment in the s-direction for the entry of the beam element.
dtheta: The rotation around the y-axis according to the right hand rule.
dpsi: The rotation around the s-axis according to the right hand rule.
mrex: The horizontal read error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.
mrey: The vertical read error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.
mscalx: The relative horizontal scaling error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.
mscaly: The relative vertical scaling error for a monitor. This is ignored if the element is not a monitor.
arex: The misalignment in the x-direction for the entry of an aperture limit.
arey: The misalignment in the y-direction for the entry of an aperture limit.

tol: The tolerance attribute is for the distinction between static and dynamic cases: if for the eigenvalues of the one-turn matrix, |e_val_5| <tol and |e_val_6| <tol, then the longitudinal motion is not considered, otherwise it is.

sequence: The name of the sequence on which to operate the matching.
q1: Enable a correction of tunes in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.
q2: Enable a correction of tunes in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.
dq1: Enable a correction of chromaticities in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.
dq2: Enable a correction of chromaticities in presence of magnetic imperfections or misalignments.

calls: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function
repeat: The number of calls of the JACOBIAN routine.
strategy: Selects the maximum number of iteration used to determine the step length which reduces the penalty function during the main iteration. A large number (i.e. 6) reduces the probability to diverge from the solution, but increases the probability of being trapped in a local minimum.

calls: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function

sequence: The name of the sequence to be processed to thin slices.
style: The slicing style to be used for all elements.
makedipedge: A logical flag to control the generation of DIPEDGE elements at the start and/or end of bending magnets, to conserve edge focusing from pole face angles E1, E2 or extra fields described by FINT, FINTX, in the process of slicing bending magnets to thin multipole slices.

deltap: Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.

calls: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function
strategy: Specifies the strategy to be used

bborbit: The closed orbit is modified by beam-beam kicks
echo: Echoes the input on the standard output file
echomacro: Issues macro expansion printout for debugging
no_fatal_stop: Prevents madx from stopping in case of a fatal error
rbarc: Converts the RBEND straight length into the arc length
reset: Resets all options to their defaults
sympl: All element matrices are symplectified in Twiss
tell: Prints the current value of all options
threader: Enables the threader for closed orbit finding in Twiss
trace: Prints the system time after each command
twiss_print: Controls whether the twiss command produces output
verify: Issues a warning if an undefined variable is used

errors_out: Write out multiple errors in EFCOMP table format
even: Even number of splits when using RESPLIT
exact: If true exact Hamiltonian is used
magnet_name: Magnet names to be used for error write out
offset_deltap: Relative momentum deviation of the reference particle.
time: Which coordinate system to use depending on 5D or 6D calculation.

ntpsa: Invokes the Differential Algebra (DA) package written in C++ and kindly provided by Lingyun Yang (lyyang@lbl.gov). Etienne Forest has written the wrapper to allow the use of both the legendary DA package written in Fortran by Martin Berz (default) and this new DA package of Lingyun Yang. It is expected that this DA package will allow for the efficient calculation of a large number of DA parameters.
sector_nmul: A global variable in PTC needed for exact sector bends defining up to which order the multipole are included in solving Maxwell’s equation up to order SECTOR_NMUL_MAX. Multipoles of order N with N > SECTOR_NMUL and N <= SECTOR_NMUL_MAX are treated similar to SixTrack. If a negative value of SECTOR_NMUL_MAX is passed than it is also identified automatically. However, if multipolar parameters of the bends are to be modified inside the PTC universe, for example with PTC_READ_ERRORS, than this parameter needs to be set to a corresponding value. Please note that using large values (above 10) slows down the computations, so the smallest required value should be used.
sector_nmul_max: A global variable in PTC needed for exact sector bends defining up to which order Maxwell’s equation are solved. The value of SECTOR_NMUL_MAX must not be smaller than SECTOR_NMUL otherwise MAD-X stops with an error. If a negative value is passed than it is identified automatically by scanning the currently selected sequence.
symprint: A flag to enable the printing of the check of symplecticity. It is recommended to leave this flag set to TRUE.

closed_orbit: Turn on the closed orbit calculation.
deltap: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit
map_table: Turn on the map-table in memory
normal: Turn on the calculation of the Normal Form

table: The name of the table where values should be stored.
column: The name of the column in the table where values should be stored.
polynomial: Specifies the row of the map.
monomial: A string composed of digits that defines the monomials of the polynomial in PTC nomenclature. The length of the string should be equal to the number of variables and each digit corresponds to the exponent of the corresponding variable.
parametric: If true, and if any knobs is defined, the map element is stored as the parametric result.

debuglevel: Sets the level of debugging printout: 0 prints none, 4 prints everything
totalpath: If true, the 6th variable of PTC, i.e. 5th of MAD-X, is the total path. If false it is deviation from the reference particle, which is normally the closed orbit for closed layouts. This switch changes behaviour of the RF cavities, including RF multipoles and crab cavities.
radiation: Sets the radiation switch/internal state of PTC. In PTC basically all the elements radiate including sextupoles, solenoids and orbit correctors.
envelope: Sets the envelope switch/internal state of PTC. It allows to calculate dumping due to radiation and stochastic effects. Warning: this makes the tracking approximately twice slower, so low order should be used.
stochastic: Sets the stochastic switch/internal state of PTC. It enables stochastic emission of photons in ray tracking, it only affects PTC_TRACK and PTC_TRACKLINE. The emission is calculated during map tracking therefore PTC_TWISS or PTC_NORMAL needs to be invoked before launching the tracking (also with RADIATION, ENVELOPE and STOCHASTIC set to true). Every tracked ray will receive the same stochastic kicks.
modulation: Sets the modulation switch/internal state of PTC. It needs to be set to true to observe effect of AD dipoles.
fringe: Sets the fringe switch/internal state of PTC.

beam_envelope: Turn on the calculations of the beam envelope with PTC
closed_orbit: Turn on the closed orbit calculation
deltap: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit (used for 5D case ONLY)
element_by_element: Switch from the default turn-by-turn tracking to the element-by-element tracking
file: The name of the file output will be written to
ffile: Printing coordinates after every FFILE turns
icase: User-defined dimensionality of the phase-space (4, 5 or 6)
maxaper: Upper limits for the particle coordinates
norm_out: Transform canonical variables to action-angle variables
radiation: Turn on the synchrotron radiation calculated by an internal procedure of PTC
radiation_energy_loss: Adds the energy loss for radiation_model1
radiation_model1: Turn on the radiation according to the method given in the Ref
recloss: Create in memory a table named ”trackloss” containing the coordinates of lost particles.
space_charge: Turn on the simulations of the space charge forces between particles
turns: Number of turns to be tracked
Number of turns to be tracked. If the layout of the machine is not closed, this value is forced to TURNS=1 by PTC
everystep: a logical switch to activate the recording of track parameters at every integration step. Normally tracking data are stored internally only at the end of each element. EVERYSTEP provides the user with finer data points. It implies usage of the so called node (thin) layout.
gcs: A logical switch to store track parameters in Global Coordinate System - normally it starts at the entrance face of the first element.

beta0: The name of a BETA0 block containing the Twiss parameters to be used as input
closed_orbit: trigger the closed orbit calculation (applies to periodic solution ONLY)
deltap: relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit
deltap_dependency: trigger the computation of the Twiss and dispersion derivatives.
file: The name of the file TWISS output will be written to
icase: the dimensionality of the phase-space (4, 5 or 6)
ignore_map_orbit: ignore the orbit in the map and use the closed orbit instead if requested, or the orbit defined by the starting point specified with X, PX, Y, P, T, DT parameters otherwise.
initial_map_manual: trigger the use of an input map stored beforehand in file ”fort.18”, e.g. by a previous initial run of PTC_NORMAL).
initial_matrix_manual: trigger the use of the input variables RE11, ...,RE66 as the transfer matrix.
normal: saving of the normal form analysis results (the closed solution) into dedicated table called NONLIN. It is the same as ptc_normal. However, the nonlin table has format such that its coefficients can be accessed within the MADX script using table command. This permits, for example, to perform matching of these parameters or or value extraction to a variable. Also, all available orders are calculated and no select_ptc_normal is required. Currently the following parameters are calculated: tunes (and all their derivatives), dipsersions (and all their derivatives), eigen values, transfer map, resonance driving terms (generating function) and the pseudo Hamiltonian. If radiation and envelope is switched on with PTC_SETSWITCH then damping decrements, equilibrium emittances and beam sizes are calculated. Attention: the results are always the plain polynomial coefficients, which is different from ptc_normal nomenclature for some variables, which in turn always gives values of the partial derivatives. Therefore, in order to obtain values of the partial derivatives the respective factorials and binomial coefficients need to be factored out by the user.
pt: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.
range: The TWISS calculation is restricted to the specified range.
slice_magnets: activate the evaluation of Twiss parameters at each integration step inside magnets, in addition to the end face. The number of slices is determined by the number of steps (NST) that can be separately defined for each element, or otherwise set by NST parameter when creating the PTC layout. Note that the orbit rms calculated in this mode counts as valid data points both the end of the previous element and the entrance of the current element. Since the first integration node is always at the entrance of the magnet (after position offset and fringe effects are calculated) which corresponds to the same s position (and usually optical functions) as the end of the previous element, the points at the interface between magnets are included twice in the rms calculation.
t: Velocity of light times the negative time difference with respect to the reference particle. A positive T means that the particle arrives ahead of the reference particle.
trackrdts: tracking of Resonance Driving Terms (RDTs). For each element all RDTs from order 3 up to value defined by switch NO are saved in TWISSRDT table. This table contains also auxiliary columns as s position, element names, strengths and lengths such that RDT values can be plotted the same way as values from TWISS table. RDTs are elements of the generating function (GFN) of the normalization transformation and for compatibility with PTC_NORMAL notation the columns are prefixed with GNF. Because they are complex numbers 3 values are saved: real part (GNFC), imaginary part (GNFS) and amplitude (GNFA).

class: The class of elements to be selected.
clear: Deselects ALL positions in the sequence for the flag ”name”.
flag: Determines the applicability of the SELECT statement.
full: The default for the MAKETHIN flag and for tables
pattern: The regular expression pattern for the element names to be selected.
range: The range of elements to be selected.
sequence: The name of a sequence to which the selection is applied.
slice: The number of slices into which the selected elements have to be cut. Only used by MAKETHIN and FLAG=INTERPOLATE
thick: Indicate whether the selected elements are treated as thick elements by the MAKETHIN command.

format: Format output. Must double-quote each format.

command: Print the command with the values of all its parameters.

detune: If true, the detune subroutine is executed
distort1: If true, the distort1 subroutine is executed
distort2: If true, the distort2 subroutine is executed
multipole_order_range: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)
noprint: If true, no file or internal table will be created to keep the results
nosixtrack: If true, the input file fc.34 will not be generated internally by invoking the conversion routine of sixtrack and the user should provide it before the execution of the sodd command
print_all: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at each multipole will be generated
print_at_end: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at the end of the position range will be generated
start_stop: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)

tolerance: the tolerance for the numerical integrator DGAUSS
file: The name of the output file

beta0: The name of a BETA0 block containing the Twiss parameters to be used as input
centre: Enforce the calculation of the linear lattice functions at the center of the element instead of the end of the element.
chrom: A logical flag to trigger computation of the chromatic functions as well as the radiation synchrotron integrals.
deltap: Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.
file: The name of the file TWISS output will be written to
keeporbit: Store the orbit under this name at the start, and at all monitors.
line: Name of a valid beamline for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.
pt: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.
range: The TWISS calculation is restricted to the specified range.
rmatrix: If this flag is used the the one-turn map at the location of every element is calculated and prepared for storage in the twiss table.
sectoracc: Save composition of maps instead of individual maps of a sector map.
sectorfile: Name of the file to which the SECTORMAP is written.
sectormap: Initiate the calculation of a sector map.
sectorpure: Save the transfer map Rij without effects from higher order map (Tijk).
sectortable: Name of the table containing the SECTORMAP values.
sequence: Name of a valid sequence for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.
t: Velocity of light times the negative time difference with respect to the reference particle. A positive T means that the particle arrives ahead of the reference particle.
tolerance: The maximum closed orbit error, for all six orbit components, that can be tolerated during the closed orbit search. The value given in the TWISS command is only valid for the current calculation; the COGUESS command allows to change the default value for all subsequent closed orbit search calculations.
useorbit: Use the start value provided for the closed orbit search.

sequence: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.
period: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.

name: NAME
OptionalString
Name of the parameter or attribute to be varied
step: Approximate initial step size for varying the parameter

sigx: The horizontal extent of the opposite beam.
sigy: The vertical extent of the opposite beam.
xma: The horizontal displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
yma: The vertical displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
charge: The charge of particles in the opposite beam in elementary charges.
bbshape: The parameter to choose the radial density shape of the opposite beam.
width: The relative extent of the edge region.
bbdir: The direction of motion of the opposite beam relative to the beam considered.

rv1: Number of initial turns with zero voltage.
rv2: Number of turns to ramp voltage from zero to nominal.
rv3: Number of turns with nominal voltage.
rv4: Number of turns to ramp voltage from nominal to zero.
rph1: Number of initial turns with nominal phase.
rph2: Number of turns to ramp phase [2$\pi$] from nominal to specified value.
lagf: Value of the final crab RF phase lag

e1: The rotation angle for the pole face.
hgap: Half gap height of the associated SBEND
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

name: Name

command_beam.title: beam
command_beam.description: The BEAM statement defines data for the particles in a beam.

command_beta0.title: beta0
command_beta0.description: Initial lattice parameters can be set 'manually' for later commands, in particular for TWISS or the MATCH module, by using the BETA0 command attached to a label.

command_constraint.title: constraint
command_constraint.description: Simple constraints are imposed by the CONSTRAINT command.

command_ealign.title: ealign
command_ealign.description: Alignment errors are defined by the EALIGN command. The misalignments refer to the local reference system for a perfectly aligned machine. Misalignments are defined as displacements along the three coordinate axes, and rotations about the coordinate axes. Alignment errors can be assigned to all beam elements except drift spaces. The effect of misalignments is treated in a linear approximation.

command_endmatch.title: endmatch
command_endmatch.description: The ENDMATCH command terminates the matching section and deletes all tables related to the matching run.

command_global.title: global
command_global.description: In addition to conventional matching constraints that specify the optics functions at a certain position in the sequence the user can also constrain global optics parameters such as, for example, the overall machine tune and the machine chromaticity.

command_jacobian.title: jacobian
command_jacobian.description: The JACOBIAN command minimises the penalty function calculating the Jacobian and solving the linear problem. A QR or LQ decomposition is performed when the system is over or under-determined.

command_lmdif.title: lmdif
command_lmdif.description: The LMDIF command minimises the sum of squares of the constraint functions using their numerical derivatives. It is the fastest minimisation method available in MAD-X.

command_makethin.title: makethin
command_makethin.description: This module takes a sequence with thick elements and creates another one with similar functionality but composed of thin (zero length) element slices or simplified thick slices as required by MAD-X tracking or conversion to SIXTRACK input format.

command_match.title: match
command_match.description: The MATCH command is used for matching either a periodic cell or an insertion to another part of the machine.

command_migrad.title: migrad
command_migrad.description: The MIGRAD command minimises the penalty function using the numerical derivatives of the sum of squares.

command_option.title: option
command_option.description: The OPTION commands sets the logical value of a number of flags that control the behavior of MAD-X.

command_ptc_create_layout.title: ptc_create_layout
command_ptc_create_layout.description: The PTC_CREATE_LAYOUT command creates the PTC-layout according to the specified integration method and fills it with the current MAD-X sequence defined in the latest USE command.

command_ptc_create_universe.title: ptc_create_universe
command_ptc_create_universe.description: The PTC_CREATE_UNIVERSE command is required to set-up the PTC environment.

command_ptc_end.title: ptc_create_end
command_ptc_end.description: The PTC_END command turns off the PTC environment, which releases all memory and returns control to the MAD-X world proper.

command_ptc_normal.title: ptc_normal
command_ptc_normal.description: The calculation of the parameters specified by the preceding SELECT_PTC_NORMAL commands is initiated by the PTC_NORMAL command, which operates on the working beam line defined in the latest USE command.

command_ptc_observe.title: ptc_observe
command_ptc_observe.description: Besides the beginning of the beam-line, one can define an additional observation points along the machine. Subsequent PTC_TRACK command will then record the tracking data on all these observation points.

command_ptc_select.title: ptc_select
command_ptc_select.description: Selects a map element to be stored in a user-defined table, or stored as a function (Taylor series) of a defined knob. Both cases can be joined in a single PTC_SELECT command.

command_ptc_setswitch.title: ptc_setswitch
command_ptc_setswitch.description: The PTC_SETSWITCH command allows to set some global PTC states and to configure the interface between MAD-X and PTC, adapting the behavior of the program to the needs.

command_ptc_start.title: ptc_start
command_ptc_start.description: To start particle tracking, a series of initial trajectory coordinates must be given with the PTC_START command; and as many commands as initial trajectories can be given.

command_ptc_track.title: ptc_track
command_ptc_track.description: The PTC_TRACK command initiates trajectory tracking by entering the thick-lens tracking module.

command_ptc_track_end.title: ptc_track_end
command_ptc_track_end.description: The PTC_TRACK_END command terminates the command lines related to the PTC_TRACK module.

command_ptc_trackline.title: ptc_trackline
command_ptc_trackline.description: The PTC_TRACKLINE command performs particle tracking that takes into account acceleration in travelling wave cavities. It must be invoked in the scope of correctly initialized PTC environment, i.e. after PTC_CREATE_UNIVERSE and PTC_CREATE_LAYOUT commands, and before corresponding PTC_END.

command_ptc_twiss.title: ptc_twiss
command_ptc_twiss.description: The PTC_TWISS command causes computation of the Twiss parameters in Ripken’s style. It operates on the working beam line defined in the latest USE command.

command_resbeam.title: resbeam
command_resbeam.description: The RESBEAM command resets the default values of the beam belonging to the specified sequence, or of the default beam if no sequence is given.

command_savebeta.title: savebeta
command_savebeta.description: Initial lattice parameters can be saved and transfered for later commands, in particular for TWISS or the match module, with the SAVEBETA command sequence.

command_select.title: select
command_select.description: Some MAD-X commands can perform specific operations on selected elements or ranges of elements and can produce specific output for selected elements or ranges of elements.

command_show.title: show
command_show.description: The SHOW command prints the command (typically beam, beam%sequ, or an element name), with the actual value of all its parameters.

command_sodd.title: sodd
command_sodd.description: The SODD command calculates the Second Order Detuning and Distortion, as described in [3], on the beam line defined by the last USE command followed by a TWISS command.

command_touschek.title: touschek
command_touschek.description: The TOUSCHEK module computes the Touschek lifetime and the scattering rates around a lepton or hadron storage ring.

command_twiss.title: twiss
command_twiss.description: The TWISS command calculates the linear lattice functions, and optionally the chromatic functions. The coupled functions are calculated in the sense of Edwards and Teng. For the uncoupled cases they reduce to the C and S functions.

command_use.title: use
command_use.description: MAD-X operates on beamlines that must be loaded and expanded in memory before other commands can be invoked. The USE command allows this loading and expansion.

command_vary.title: vary
command_vary.description: A parameter to be varied is specified by the command VARY.

BEAMBEAM.title: BEAMBEAM
BEAMBEAM.description: A straight magnetic field element using generalized gradient expansion.

CHANGEREF.title: CHANGEREF
CHANGEREF.description: The element CHANGEREF changes the reference system by applying both translations and rotations.

DIPEDGE.title: DIPEDGE
DIPEDGE.description: A thin element describing the edge focusing of a dipole has been introduced in order to make it possible to track trajectories in the presence of dipoles with pole face angles. Only linear terms are considered since the higher order terms would make the tracking non-symplectic.

HACDIPOLE.title: HACDIPOLE
HACDIPOLE.description: An AC dipole for the horizontal plane

HKICKER.title: HKICKER
HKICKER.description: A corrector for the horizontal plane

HMONITOR.title: HMONITOR
HMONITOR.description: Monitor for the horizontal beam position

INSTRUMENT.title: INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT.description: An instrument or a placeholder has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. An instrument is different from beam a position monitor and is not used for closed orbit correction.

MARKER.title: MARKER
MARKER.description: The MARKER has zero length and has no effect on the beam, but it allows one to identify a position in the beam line, for example to apply a matching constraint.

MATRIX.title: MATRIX
MATRIX.description: The MATRIX element allows the definition of an arbitrary transfer matrix.

MONITOR.title: MONITOR
MONITOR.description: A beam monitor has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. In addition it serves to record the beam position for closed orbit correction.

MULTIPOLE.title: MULTIPOLE
MULTIPOLE.description: A MULTIPOLE is a thin-lens magnet of arbitrary order, including a dipole component.

NLLENS.title: NLLENS
NLLENS.description: The NLLENS element represents a thin nonlinear lens with the potential of 'Elliptic' type. The lens is used to create fully integrable 2D nonlinear accelerator lattice with very large nonlinear tune spread/shift. The NLLENS element is recognized by the thin tracking module. The quadrupole term of the potential is included in the transport map and, consequently, affects the calculation of tunes and Twiss functions.

PLACEHOLDER.title: PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER.description: An instrument or a placeholder has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. An instrument is different from beam a position monitor and is not used for closed orbit correction.

RBEND.title: RBEND
RBEND.description: RBEND is a specific case of SBEND. The pole faces are parallel. The reference system is the curved rbend reference system.

RFMULTIPOLE.title: RFMULTIPOLE
RFMULTIPOLE.description: A RFMULTIPOLE is a element which exhibits the properties of an RF cavity as well as those of a multipole, of arbitrary order, oscillating at the same RF frequency.

SBEND.title: SBEND
SBEND.description: SBEND is a sector bending magnet. The planes of the pole faces intersect at the centre of curvature of the curved sbend reference system.

SROTATION.title: SROTATION
SROTATION.description: The element SROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the longitudinal (s) axis.

TRANSLATION.title: TRANSLATION
TRANSLATION.description: The element TRANSLATION changes the reference system by applying a translation of the reference system.

TWCAVITY.title: TWCAVITY
TWCAVITY.description: The travelling wave cavities model the accelerating structures of linacs where wavefront moves together with the accelerated particles. This element is implemented only by PTC and is treated as drift by native MADX commands. The phase velocity is fixed to speed of light and can not be varied.

VACDIPOLE.title: VACDIPOLE
VACDIPOLE.description: An AC dipole for the vertical plane

VKICKER.title: VKICKER
VKICKER.description: A corrector for the vertical plane

VMONITOR.title: VMONITOR
VMONITOR.description: Monitor for the vertical beam position

XROTATION.title: XROTATION
XROTATION.description: The element XROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the vertical (x) axis.

YROTATION.title: YROTATION
YROTATION.description: The element YROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the vertical (y) axis.
